title: Anfield to stage first women's Merseyside derby in November
text:
Anfield will host its first ever women’s league game for the Merseyside derby over the inaugural FA women’s football weekend next month.

The 54,000 capacity stadium will become the third men’s stadium to host a Women’s Super League game on Sunday November 17.

As well as Liverpool's clash with Everton, the new Tottenham Hotspur Stadium will host Spurs versus north London rivals Arsenal and Reading will welcome Bristol City to the Madejski for the third of four games to be held at the club's main stadium before the end of the calendar year.

The FA's women's football weekend, which is scheduled during an international break in the Premier League and Football League, is to encourage as many people as possible to attend a women's football match. It looks to become another landmark in the growing popularity of the women’s game.

The move comes after Manchester United manager Casey Stoney revealed last week she had turned down the offer of hosting a League Cup match at Old Trafford.
description: Anfield will host its first ever women’s league game for the Merseyside derby over the inaugural FA women’s football weekend next month.
